commitResults.messageTitle: Update Duke.java to complete Level 0: Greet
Add response functionality to "bye" for Boba (Level-1)
Refactor printSeparator() to botResponse() to reduce redunancy
Add mark and unmark functionality to Boba bot
Add new classes: Todo, Deadline, and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
New classes are subclasses of Task
The implementation of inheritance allows for further subsection of what user may want.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor Duke.java to be split into multiple methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Huge update. Introduction of enums for faster comparison than Strings
and to better take advantage of switch statements.
This also makes it extremely easy to add new commands

Add HELP command also for better user experience

Add many functions to handle edge cases.
The bot now tells the user when the command is invalid and sometimes why.
The bot does not break when commands are inputted not expected
Overall improvement of user experience.

Also remove global variable responses and keep it local in methods.
Readd the previously remove edge case on task limit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new additions based on PR feedback
commitResults.messageBody:
Update javadoc to include all methods
Create new class TaskManager to handle specifically task related items
Change Duke.java to Boba.java to fit our bot's name

Many changes still need to done for code quality.
- Move getCommand to Command.java
- Find a better way to print out botResponse
- Refactor error/invalid command handling

commitResults.messageTitle: Move getCommand from Boba.java to Command.java
Add Exception handling to Boba and TaskManager
commitResults.messageBody:
This will replace our previous more naive solution: printInvalidCommand
New exception class and handling shows flaws with current botResponse.
- Refactor botResponse method to a class

commitResults.messageTitle: Update botResponse method to BobaResponse class
commitResults.messageBody:
BobaResponse is currently just an utility class.
It uses the same instance for all responses.

Use combination BobaException and ErrorHandler for unexpected user inputs
Update error messages
Add Javadoc for new classes and methods
